page.title: 17Farming, Bathgate part 1
page.content: In this area there are 7 large farms. We found, from our land survey that most of the surrounding land is rough grazing land. On this land many farmers will graze cows, as that is the only animal that will eat such coarse grass. I have chosen one small farmstead out of all the large farms to write about. On this farmstead live husband and wife, who breed rabbits and goats. The goats produce many litres of milk per day. There are 18 goats on the farmstead and ten of them produce milk. The rabbits are bred for their meat and their fur. The meat is sold to the butcher. Another thing they do is take their horse up to a country park, just outside this area. They charge 50p for a ride with the horse and cart, round the park.
